security: The document contains Social Security numbers, which are redacted because public disclosure could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy. The Review Board determined this invasion of privacy would be so substantial that it outweighs the public interest.
summary: This document includes a Final Determination Notification from the Assassination Records Review Board regarding the postponement of Social Security numbers within HSCA staff payroll records, accompanied by payroll authorization forms and a memorandum related to S. Jonathan Blackmer's employment and payroll certifications.
summary_one_paragraph: This collection of documents pertains to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) and includes a Final Determination Notification detailing the postponement of Social Security numbers due to privacy concerns, several payroll authorization forms documenting the employment and salary adjustments of S. Jonathan Blackmer from 1976 to 1979, and a memorandum regarding payroll certification requirements related to staff members' relationships to members of Congress. The payroll forms, signed by authorizing officials such as Louis Stokes and Henry B. Gonzalez, show Blackmer's various positions and salary changes within the HSCA.
title: HSCA Staff Payroll Records: Final Determination Notification and Payroll Authorizations
recipient: Clerk of the House of Representatives
